content.description: Start on the juggy set of slots just to the right of the circled start holds for Kirchoff's loop law. Climb straight up and top out. This route serves as a good warmup for the other climbs on the wall.FA unknown; if you have any information on who first cleaned and climbed this boulder please share so I can add to the page. The line has very clearly been climbed before and I was surprised to find it not already listed here on MP.
content.location: This climb is to the left of Electric Boogaloo.

content.description:
Climb in a perpetual loop.  Start where you want; the Engineer in me  says start in one of the bottom corners though. Option 1) Climb up, traverse, climb down, traverse, repeat.  Option 2) Traverse, climb up, traverse, climb down, repeat. How many times can you complete the loop without coming off the wall?

 Really hard to grade this climb as it gets harder with each loop completed!
Sit start at the obvious crack on the right side of the wall, follow the crack line to the top, two move traverse left to mantle top out.
content.location: Right side of the wall with the obvious deep crack.

content.description: Sit start using large right hand pocket and smaller left pocket. Move up to ledges below blank section, plan your feet, because they will disappear. Use high feet to get to crux, and work your way through to the top out.
content.location: Center of wall. Starts under the more blank area of the wall and works slightly right into the more pocketed portion of the wall.

content.description: This area sees more sun than most of the other areas on the southside. Just a short walk from the kiosk and you are there. Landing area is flat and naturally very open. Great spot for a small group of boulderers. Wall is about 15 feet high.
